name: 100rel
description: Allow support for RFC3262 provisional ACK tags

name: accept_multiple_sdp_answers
description: Accept multiple SDP answers on non-100rel responses

name: accountcode
description: An accountcode to set automatically on any channels created for this endpoint.

name: acl
description: List of IP ACL section names in acl.conf

name: aggregate_mwi
description: Condense MWI notifications into a single NOTIFY.

name: allow
description: Media Codec(s) to allow

name: allow_overlap
description: Enable RFC3578 overlap dialing support.

name: allow_subscribe
description: Determines if endpoint is allowed to initiate subscriptions with p-line.

name: allow_transfer
description: Determines whether SIP REFER transfers are allowed for this endpoint

name: aors
description: AoR(s) to be used with the endpoint

name: asymmetric_rtp_codec
description: Allow the sending and receiving RTP codec to differ

name: auth
description: Authentication Object(s) associated with the endpoint

name: bind_rtp_to_media_address
description: Bind the RTP instance to the media_address

name: bundle
description: Enable RTP bundling

name: call_group
description: The numeric pickup groups for a channel.

name: callerid
description: CallerID information for the endpoint

name: callerid_privacy
description: Default privacy level

name: callerid_tag
description: Internal id_tag for the endpoint

name: connected_line_method
options: {invite=invite - When set to invite, check the remote's Allow header and if UPDATE is allowed, send UPDATE instead of INVITE to avoid SDP renegotiation. If UPDATE is not Allowed, send INVITE, reinvite=Alias for the invite value, update=update - If set to update, send UPDATE regardless of what the remote Allows}
description: Connected line method type

name: contact_acl
description: List of Contact ACL section names in acl.conf

name: contact_deny
description: List of Contact header addresses to deny

name: contact_permit
description: List of Contact header addresses to permit

name: contact_user
description: Force the user on the outgoing Contact header to this value.

name: context
description: Dialplan context for inbound sessions

name: cos_audio
description: Priority for audio streams

name: cos_video
description: Priority for video streams

name: deny
description: List of IP addresses to deny access from

name: device_state_busy_at
description: The number of in-use channels which will cause busy to be returned as device state

name: direct_media
description: Determines whether media may flow directly between endpoints.

name: direct_media_glare_mitigation
description: Mitigation of direct media (re)INVITE glare

name: direct_media_method
options: {invite=invite, reinvite=reinvite - Alias for the invite value, update=update}
description: Direct Media method type

name: disable_direct_media_on_nat
description: Disable direct media session refreshes when NAT obstructs the media session

name: dtls_auto_generate_cert
description: Whether or not to automatically generate an ephemeral X.509 certificate

name: dtls_ca_file
description: Path to certificate authority certificate

name: dtls_ca_path
description: Path to a directory containing certificate authority certificates

name: dtls_cert_file
description: Path to certificate file to present to peer

name: dtls_cipher
description: Cipher to use for DTLS negotiation

name: dtls_fingerprint
description: Type of hash to use for the DTLS fingerprint in the SDP.

name: dtls_private_key
description: Path to private key for certificate file

name: dtls_rekey
description: Interval at which to renegotiate the TLS session and rekey the SRTP session

name: dtls_setup
description: Whether we are willing to accept connections, connect to the other party, or both.

name: dtls_verify
description: Verify that the provided peer certificate is valid

name: dtmf_mode
options: {rfc4733=rfc4733 - DTMF is sent out of band of the main audio stream. This supercedes the older RFC-2833 used within the older chan_sip, inband=inband - DTMF is sent as part of audio stream, info=info - DTMF is sent as SIP INFO packets, auto=auto - DTMF is sent as RFC 4733 if the other side supports it or as INBAND if not, auto_info=auto_info - DTMF is sent as RFC 4733 if the other side supports it or as SIP INFO if not}
description: DTMF mode

name: fax_detect
description: Whether CNG tone detection is enabled

name: fax_detect_timeout
description: How long into a call before fax_detect is disabled for the call

name: follow_early_media_fork
description: Follow SDP forked media when To tag is different

name: force_avp
description: Determines whether res_pjsip will use and enforce usage of AVP, regardless of the RTP profile in use for this endpoint.

name: force_rport
description: Force use of return port

name: from_domain
description: Domain to user in From header for requests to this endpoint.

name: from_user
description: Username to use in From header for requests to this endpoint.

name: g726_non_standard
description: Force g.726 to use AAL2 packing order when negotiating g.726 audio

name: ice_support
description: Enable the ICE mechanism to help traverse NAT

name: identify_by
description: Way(s) for the endpoint to be identified

name: inband_progress
description: Determines whether chan_pjsip will indicate ringing using inband progress.

name: incoming_mwi_mailbox
description: Mailbox name to use when incoming MWI NOTIFYs are received

name: language
description: Set the default language to use for channels created for this endpoint.

name: mailboxes
description: NOTIFY the endpoint when state changes for any of the specified mailboxes

name: max_audio_streams
description: The maximum number of allowed audio streams for the endpoint

name: max_video_streams
description: The maximum number of allowed video streams for the endpoint

name: media_address
description: IP address used in SDP for media handling

name: media_encryption
description: Determines whether res_pjsip will use and enforce usage of media encryption for this endpoint.

name: media_encryption_optimistic
description: Determines whether encryption should be used if possible but does not terminate the session if not achieved.

name: media_use_received_transport
description: Determines whether res_pjsip will use the media transport received in the offer SDP in the corresponding answer SDP.

name: message_context
description: Context to route incoming MESSAGE requests to.

name: moh_passthrough
description: Determines whether hold and unhold will be passed through using re-INVITEs with recvonly and sendrecv to the remote side

name: moh_suggest
description: Default Music On Hold class

name: mwi_from_user
description: Username to use in From header for unsolicited MWI NOTIFYs to this endpoint.

name: mwi_subscribe_replaces_unsolicited
description: An MWI subscribe will replace sending unsolicited NOTIFYs

name: named_call_group
description: The named pickup groups for a channel.

name: named_pickup_group
description: The named pickup groups that a channel can pickup.

name: notify_early_inuse_ringing
description: Whether to notifies dialog-info 'early' on InUse&Ringing state

name: one_touch_recording
description: Determines whether one-touch recording is allowed for this endpoint.

name: outbound_auth
description: Authentication object(s) used for outbound requests

name: outbound_proxy
description: Full SIP URI of the outbound proxy used to send requests

name: permit
description: List of IP addresses to permit access from

name: pickup_group
description: The numeric pickup groups that a channel can pickup.

name: preferred_codec_only
description: Respond to a SIP invite with the single most preferred codec rather than advertising all joint codec capabilities. This limits the other side's codec choice to exactly what we prefer.

name: record_off_feature
description: The feature to enact when one-touch recording is turned off.

name: record_on_feature
description: The feature to enact when one-touch recording is turned on.

name: redirect_method
description: How redirects received from an endpoint are handled

name: refer_blind_progress
description: Whether to notifies all the progress details on blind transfer

name: rewrite_contact
description: Allow Contact header to be rewritten with the source IP address-port

name: rpid_immediate
description: Immediately send connected line updates on unanswered incoming calls.

name: rtcp_mux
description: Enable RFC 5761 RTCP multiplexing on the RTP port

name: rtp_engine
description: Name of the RTP engine to use for channels created for this endpoint

name: rtp_ipv6
description: Allow use of IPv6 for RTP traffic

name: rtp_keepalive
description: Number of seconds between RTP comfort noise keepalive packets.

name: rtp_symmetric
description: Enforce that RTP must be symmetric

name: rtp_timeout
description: Maximum number of seconds without receiving RTP (while off hold) before terminating call.

name: rtp_timeout_hold
description: Maximum number of seconds without receiving RTP (while on hold) before terminating call.

name: sdp_owner
description: String placed as the username portion of an SDP origin (o=) line.

name: sdp_session
description: String used for the SDP session (s=) line.

name: send_diversion
description: Send the Diversion header, conveying the diversion information to the called user agent

name: send_pai
description: Send the P-Asserted-Identity header

name: send_rpid
description: Send the Remote-Party-ID header

name: set_var
description: Variable set on a channel involving the endpoint.

name: srtp_tag_32
description: Determines whether 32 byte tags should be used instead of 80 byte tags.

name: sub_min_expiry
description: The minimum allowed expiry time for subscriptions initiated by the endpoint.

name: subscribe_context
description: Context for incoming MESSAGE requests.

name: suppress_q850_reason_headers
description: Suppress Q.850 Reason headers for this endpoint

name: t38_udptl
description: Whether T.38 UDPTL support is enabled or not

name: t38_udptl_ec
description: T.38 UDPTL error correction method

name: t38_udptl_ipv6
description: Whether IPv6 is used for UDPTL Sessions

name: t38_udptl_maxdatagram
description: T.38 UDPTL maximum datagram size

name: t38_udptl_nat
description: Whether NAT support is enabled on UDPTL sessions

name: timers
options: {no=no, yes=yes, required=required, always=always, forced=forced - Alias of always}
description: Session timers for SIP packets

name: timers_min_se
description: Minimum session timers expiration period

name: timers_sess_expires
description: Maximum session timer expiration period

name: tone_zone
description: Set which country's indications to use for channels created for this endpoint.

name: tos_audio
description: DSCP TOS bits for audio streams

name: tos_video
description: DSCP TOS bits for video streams

name: transport
description: Explicit transport configuration to use

name: trust_id_inbound
description: Accept identification information received from this endpoint

name: trust_id_outbound
description: Send private identification details to the endpoint.

name: use_avpf
description: Determines whether res_pjsip will use and enforce usage of AVPF for this endpoint.

name: use_ptime
description: Use Endpoint's requested packetization interval

name: user_eq_phone
description: Determines whether a user=phone parameter is placed into the request URI if the user is determined to be a phone number

name: voicemail_extension
description: The voicemail extension to send in the NOTIFY Message-Account header

name: webrtc
description: Defaults and enables some options that are relevant to WebRTC

name: auth_type
description: Authentication type

name: nonce_lifetime
description: Lifetime of a nonce associated with this authentication config.

name: md5_cred
description: MD5 Hash used for authentication.

name: password
description: Plain text password used for authentication.

name: realm
description: SIP realm for endpoint

name: username
description: Username to use for account

name: bind
description: IP Address and optional port to bind to for this transport

name: ca_list_file
description: File containing a list of certificates to read (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

name: ca_list_path
description: Path to directory containing a list of certificates to read (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

name: cert_file
description: Certificate file for endpoint (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

name: cipher
description: Preferred cryptography cipher names (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

name: domain
description: Domain the transport comes from

name: external_media_address
description: External IP address to use in RTP handling

name: external_signaling_address
description: External address for SIP signalling

name: external_signaling_port
description: External port for SIP signalling

name: method
options: {default=default - The default as defined by PJSIP. This is currently TLSv1, but may change with future releases, unspecified=unspecified - This option is equivalent to setting 'default', tlsv1=tlsv1, tlsv1_1=tlsv1_1, tlsv1_2=tlsv1_2, sslv2=sslv2, sslv3=sslv3, sslv23=sslv23}
description: Method of SSL transport (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

name: local_net
description: Network to consider local (used for NAT purposes).

name: password
description: Password required for transport

name: priv_key_file
description: Private key file (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

name: protocol
description: Protocol to use for SIP traffic

name: require_client_cert
description: Require client certificate (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

name: verify_client
description: Require verification of client certificate (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

name: verify_server
description: Require verification of server certificate (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

name: tos
description: Enable TOS for the signalling sent over this transport

name: cos
description: Enable COS for the signalling sent over this transport

name: websocket_write_timeout
description: The timeout (in milliseconds) to set on WebSocket connections.

name: allow_reload
description: Allow this transport to be reloaded.

name: symmetric_transport
description: Use the same transport for outgoing requests as incoming ones.

name: uri
description: SIP URI to contact peer

name: expiration_time
description: Time to keep alive a contact

name: qualify_frequency
description: Interval at which to qualify a contact

name: qualify_timeout
description: Timeout for qualify

name: authenticate_qualify
description: Authenticates a qualify challenge response if needed

name: outbound_proxy
description: Outbound proxy used when sending OPTIONS request

name: path
description: Stored Path vector for use in Route headers on outgoing requests.

name: user_agent
description: User-Agent header from registration.

name: endpoint
description: Endpoint name

name: reg_server
description: p-line Server name

name: via_addr
description: IP-address of the last Via header from registration.

name: via_port
description: IP-port of the last Via header from registration.

name: call_id
description: Call-ID header from registration.

name: prune_on_boot
description: A contact that cannot survive a restart/boot.

name: contact
description: Permanent contacts assigned to AoR

name: default_expiration
description: Default expiration time in seconds for contacts that are dynamically bound to an AoR.

name: mailboxes
description: Allow subscriptions for the specified mailbox(es)

name: voicemail_extension
description: The voicemail extension to send in the NOTIFY Message-Account header

name: maximum_expiration
description: Maximum time to keep an AoR

name: max_contacts
description: Maximum number of contacts that can bind to an AoR

name: minimum_expiration
description: Minimum keep alive time for an AoR

name: remove_existing
description: Determines whether new contacts replace existing ones.

name: qualify_frequency
description: Interval at which to qualify an AoR

name: qualify_timeout
description: Timeout for qualify

name: authenticate_qualify
description: Authenticates a qualify challenge response if needed

name: outbound_proxy
description: Outbound proxy used when sending OPTIONS request

name: support_path
description: Enables Path support for REGISTER requests and Route support for other requests.

name: timer_t1
description: Set transaction timer T1 value (milliseconds).

name: timer_b
description: Set transaction timer B value (milliseconds).

name: compact_headers
description: Use the short forms of common SIP header names.

name: threadpool_initial_size
description: Initial number of threads in the res_pjsip threadpool.

name: threadpool_auto_increment
description: The amount by which the number of threads is incremented when necessary.

name: threadpool_idle_timeout
description: Number of seconds before an idle thread should be disposed of.

name: threadpool_max_size
description: Maximum number of threads in the res_pjsip threadpool. A value of 0 indicates no maximum.

name: disable_tcp_switch
description: Disable automatic switching from UDP to TCP transports.

name: follow_early_media_fork
description: Follow SDP forked media when To tag is different

name: accept_multiple_sdp_answers
description: Follow SDP forked media when To tag is the same

name: max_forwards
description: Value used in Max-Forwards header for SIP requests.

name: keep_alive_interval
description: The interval (in seconds) to send keepalives to active connection-oriented transports.

name: contact_expiration_check_interval
description: The interval (in seconds) to check for expired contacts.

name: disable_multi_domain
description: Disable Multi Domain support

name: max_initial_qualify_time
description: The maximum amount of time from startup that qualifies should be attempted on all contacts. If greater than the qualify_frequency for an aor, qualify_frequency will be used instead.

name: unidentified_request_period
description: The number of seconds over which to accumulate unidentified requests.

name: unidentified_request_count
description: The number of unidentified requests from a single IP to allow.

name: unidentified_request_prune_interval
description: The interval at which unidentified requests are older than twice the unidentified_request_period are pruned.

name: user_agent
description: Value used in User-Agent header for SIP requests and Server header for SIP responses.

name: regcontext
description: When set, p-line will dynamically create and destroy a NoOp priority 1 extension for a given peer who registers or unregisters with us.

name: default_outbound_endpoint
description: Endpoint to use when sending an outbound request to a URI without a specified endpoint.

name: default_voicemail_extension
description: The voicemail extension to send in the NOTIFY Message-Account header if not specified on endpoint or aor

name: debug
defaultValue: Enable/Disable SIP debug logging. Valid options include yes
description: no or a host address

name: endpoint_identifier_order
description: The order by which endpoint identifiers are processed and checked. Identifier names are usually derived from and can be found in the endpoint identifier module itself (res_pjsip_endpoint_identifier_*). You can use the CLI command "pjsip show identifiers" to see the identifiers currently available.

name: default_from_user
description: When p-line generates an outgoing SIP request, the From header username will be set to this value if there is no better option (such as CallerID) to be used.

name: default_realm
description: When p-line generates a challenge, the digest realm will be set to this value if there is no better option (such as auth/realm) to be used.

name: mwi_tps_queue_high
description: MWI taskprocessor high water alert trigger level.

name: mwi_tps_queue_low
description: MWI taskprocessor low water clear alert level.

name: mwi_disable_initial_unsolicited
description: Enable/Disable sending unsolicited MWI to all endpoints on startup.

name: ignore_uri_user_options
description: Enable/Disable ignoring SIP URI user field options.
